name: Agrawal's conjecture
rephrased: Agrawal's conjecture states that for any two coprime positive integers n and r, if n is prime then n² ≡ 1 (mod r) whenever the polynomial congruence (X-1)^n ≡ X^n - 1 (mod n, X^r - 1) holds.
explained: Agrawal's conjecture states that for any two coprime positive integers n and r, if the polynomial congruence (X-1)^n ≡ X^n - 1 holds modulo n and the polynomial X^r - 1, then either n is prime or n^2 ≡ 1 (mod r).
related_conjectures: Generalized Riemann Hypothesis (related to efficient primality testing)
